catalog.title: Info and Health Care Envnt
catalog.description: Introduces students to the health care environment emphasizing the interface between the health care delivery system and informatics. Explores various environments where people obtain health care, including clinics, hospitals, and community settings. Students become familiar with health care terminology, government health policies, and the influence of managed care organizations on the health care environment.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Informatics and the Health Care Environment
catalog.requisites_description: NUR Upper Division Prerequisite: Admission to the Nursing Program

catalog.title: Info and Health Care Envnt
catalog.description: Introduces students to the health care environment emphasizing the interface between the health care delivery system and informatics. Explores various environments where people obtain health care, including clinics, hospitals, and community settings. Students become familiar with health care terminology, government health policies, and the influence of managed care organizations on the health care environment.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Informatics and the Health Care Environment
catalog.requisites_description: NUR Upper Division Prerequisite: Admission to the Nursing Program

catalog.title: Nursing Care Wmn and Child
catalog.description: Describes the characteristics of primary health care and its delivery. Examines the nurse's role in delivery of primary health/community-based services focusing on health promotion, disease prevention, and management of episodic illness. Addresses health risks of age groups across the life span within the context of family, culture, and socioeconomic level. Healthy People Goals and other national initiatives provide direction for developing strategies. Must be taken in program sequence.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core

catalog.title: Ethics for the Health Profess
catalog.description: This course prepares undergraduate students to identify and address multiple ethical issues arising within professional practice and the dynamic health care delivery system. With the use of ethical theories and principles the student will apply ethical decision making models to address dilemmas within practice, health care systems, and global communities. This course is designed to provide strategies for promoting ethical practice and developing ethical leadership within the technological health care environment.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core

catalog.title: UB Seminar
catalog.description: The one credit UB Seminar is focused on a big idea or challenging issue to engage students with questions of significance in a field of study and, ultimately, to connect their studies with issues of consequence in the wider world.  Essential to the UB Curriculum, the Seminar helps transition to UB through an early connection to UB faculty and the undergraduate experience at a comprehensive, research university. This course is equivalent to any 198 offered in any subject.  This course is a controlled enrollment (impacted) course. Students who have previously attempted the course and received a grade of F or R may not be able to repeat the course during the fall or spring semester.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.requisites_description: Students who have already successfully completed the UB seminar course may not repeat this course. If you have any questions regarding enrollment for this course, please contact your academic advisor.
catalog.requisites: Students who have already successfully completed the UB seminar course may not repeat this course. If you have any questions regarding enrollment for this course, please contact your academic advisor

notes.note: Traditional BS students only. Clinicals may be scheduled Wednesday through Sunday from 6:00 AM to 7:30 PM.

catalog.title: Nrsg Care Wmn & Chld Prac
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Nursing Care of Women and Children Practicum

catalog.title: Human Growth & Developmnt
catalog.description: Examines selected physiological and psychosocial factors that influence and characterize human growth and development throughout the life span. Includes lecture/discussion and class participation activities.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core

notes.note: Clinicals may be scheduled Wednesday through Sunday from 6:00 AM to 7:30 PM.

catalog.title: Nurs Mgt of Patients
catalog.description: Reviews knowledge and skills required to care for patients throughout their life spans who have complex, life-threatening health problems, including trauma, problems with oxygenation, disruptions of the nervous system, and disruption of the immune system. Emphasizes assessment skills and nursing interventions to restore physiological and psychological stability.  Must be taken in program sequence.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Nursing Management of Patients with Complex Acute Health Care Problems
catalog.requisites_description:
Pre-Requisite: NSG 410, NSG 470, NSG 474.
Co-Requisite: NSG 475, NSG 481, NSG 479.

catalog.title: Promoting Quality Health
catalog.description: Examines nursing management skills and behaviors with applicability in a wide variety of client-care settings. Emphasizes organizational structure and behavior, applying information management and case-management techniques to the management of care for groups of clients, and applying principles of delegation, supervision, and personnel evaluation to management of care provided by others.  Must be taken in program sequence.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Promoting Quality Health Outcomes and Culture of Safety

notes.note: Clinicals may be scheduled any day from 6:00 AM to 7:30 PM.

catalog.title: Advanced Clinical Nursg
catalog.description: Clinical course that provides students opportunities to pursue, independently and in depth, a specific nursing area of particular interest. Expects ongoing student, faculty, and preceptor collaboration. Students participate in selecting the site for clinical experience.  Must be taken in program sequence.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.requisites_description: NUR Upper Division Prerequisite: Admission to the Nursing Program

catalog.title: Evdnce Bsd Prac & Nur Research
catalog.description: Foundations for evidence-based practice in nursing. Specific elements of evidence-based practice include formulating the clinical question, conducting a search strategy, critically appraising the evidence, and implementation of evidence in the clinical environment.  Basic concepts of the research process will form the foundation for assessing the quality of evidence. Explores the relationship between evidence-based findings and nursing practice to achieve favorable and cost-containing client outcomes. Must be taken in program sequence. This course is equivalent to NBC 348.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Evidence Based Practice and Nursing Research
catalog.requisites_description:
Pre-Requisite: NSG 295 or PSY 207 or STA 119 or SSC 225 or CEP 207.
Completion of Communication Literacy 1 or completion of Writing Skills 1 (ENG 101 or placement into ENG 201); Admission to the Nursing Program.
catalog.prerequisites:
NSG 295 or PSY 207 or STA 119 or SSC 225 or CEP 207
Completion of Communication Literacy 1 or completion of Writing Skills 1 (ENG 101 or placement into ENG 201); Admission to the Nursing Program.

This course is equivalent to NBC 348.

catalog.title: Complex Acute Care
catalog.description: Reviews knowledge and skills required to care for patients throughout their life spans who have complex, life-threatening health problems, including trauma, problems with oxygenation, disruptions of the nervous system, and disruption of the immune system. Emphasizes assessment skills and nursing interventions to restore physiological and psychological stability.  Must be taken in program sequence.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.requisites_description:
Pre-Requisite: NSG 410, NSG 470, NSG 474.
Co-Requisite: NSG 475, NSG 481, NSG 479.

catalog.title: Professional Nursing Practice
catalog.description: Prepares the baccalaureate nursing student for transition to professional nursing practice as a leader/manager.  Discusses organizational structures and processes of heath care organizations as context for professional nursing practice.  Analyzes the collaborative roles of the nurse as leader and manager within the framework of legislative, economic, and regulated health care environments.  Explores the legal and ethical parameters which influence the role of the nurse as leader/manager. A personal career plan is developed that incorporates strategies and processes for successful transition and practice.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
catalog.long_title: Transitionling to Professional Nursing Practice as a Leader/Manager
catalog.requisites_description:
Pre-Requisite: NSG 410, NSG 470, NSG 474.
Co-Requisite: NSG 478, NSG 479, NSG 481.

catalog.title: Sem Acute Care
catalog.description: Content derived from clinical situations encountered in NUR 478L Nursing Therapeutics in Complex Acute Care. Students share clinical reports and raise critical questions regarding practice issues and propose and evaluate responses. Issues focus on direct care, health-system concerns, and professional interactions at both the client and system levels.  Must be taken in program sequence.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core

catalog.title: Nursing Honors Research
catalog.description: Students accepted into the School of Nursing Honors Research program must complete this course twice, during both semesters of the senior year.  It will provide an opportunity for outstanding undergraduate nursing students to enrich their education and gain personal recognition through participation in the scholarly work of a research faculty member.  In concert with a faculty member, the student will conduct a research project that culminates into a senior thesis of publication quality.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core

catalog.title: Statistics for Health Care
catalog.description: This course provides a foundation in  elementary statistics essential to  read, understand, and apply evidence-based health care literature.  Concepts of measurement, measurement reliability, sampling methods, and common statistical analysis will be examined. An understanding of course concepts will be developed through an examination of selected evidence-based health care literature.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core

catalog.title: Supervised Teaching
catalog.description: Outstanding undergraduate students can enrich their education and gain personal recognition through participation in a supervised teaching experience with a Nursing faculty member.  In concert with the faculty member, student teachers will have an opportunity to develop their leadership, management, teaching, technology, and presentation skills in a course previously completed.
catalog.subject: Undergraduate Nursing Core
